result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

03:48 PM Defendant Adam Joseph Huschka in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Court orders $400 Signature Bond with conditions: No contact with KS.  No violent or disorderly contact with KH. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
